lead_paragraph: The former Detroit Red Wings center Igor Larionov and the ex-Edmonton Oilers star Glenn Anderson have been elected to the Hall of Fame. The former linesman Ray Scapinello and the Ed Chynoweth, in the builder category, also made the Hall on Tuesday. The induction ceremony will be held Nov. 10. Larionov won two Olympic gold medals with the Soviet Union and was one of the first Soviet players to play in the N.H.L. He won three Stanley Cups with Detroit and had 644 points in 921 N.H.L. games.
